The <Checkbox/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/checkbox
import { Checkbox } from "matro-ui"; Copy Checkbox: Checkbox input
Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20}}> <Checkbox disabled> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox disabled checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

Pass the font-size to change the size of the Checkbox. Values can be either px, em, rem or %. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "14px"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "16px"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "1.2rem"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

You can override the color scheme of the Checkbox to any color by providing the css variable --bg. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "red"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "#48b048"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "#4848d7"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

Pass the toggle prop to change the view of the Checkbox. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "14px"}} checked toggle> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "16px"}} checked toggle> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "1.2rem", "--bg": "#48b048"}} checked toggle> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>
Alternatively, you can use the <Toggle/> component. It wraps Checkbox and pass all props to it. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Toggle style={{fontSize: "1.1rem"}} checked toggle> Toggle </Toggle>

value DescriptionThe value of the checkbox. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the checkbox value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the checkbox. Typestring checked DescriptionIndicates whether the checkbox is checked. Typeboolean toggle DescriptionIndicates whether the checkbox is in toggle mode. Typeboolean linear DescriptionIndicates whether the checkbox has a linear type of animation. Typeboolean
The <InputNumber/> component is similar to the Input component, but it has controls for incrementing or decrementing numeric values. Source@matro-ui/inputnumber
import { InputNumber, InputNumberField } from "matro-ui"; Copy InputNumber: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components. InputNumberField: The input field itself.

Combine <InputNumber/>, <InputText/>, <InputChildSelect/>, <InputChildPrefix/> as you prefer to create any kind of input: Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack column> <LabelText>Example of currency-num</LabelText> <InputNumber placeholder="0.00"> <InputChildPrefix value="$"/> <InputNumberField/> <InputChildSelect name="select-name-prop" defaultValue="pln"> <option value="eur">EUR</option> <option value="usd">USD</option> <option value="pln">PLN</option> </InputChildSelect> </InputNumber> </Stack> Loading... Copy Live Editor function Search () { const [value, setValue] = React.useState("") const handleChange = (e) => { setValue(e.target.value); } return( <Stack column> <LabelText>Example of search</LabelText> <InputText placeholder="Search..." value={value} onChange={handleChange}> <InputTextField/> <InputChildButton children={<IoSearch />} onClick={() => {alert("Query: " + value); setValue("");}}/> </InputText> </Stack> ); } Loading... Copy Live Editor <label> <LabelText>Example of link-text</LabelText> <InputText color="cyangreen" placeholder="example.com" name="input-name-prop" > <InputChildPrefix value="https://"/> <InputTextField/> <InputChildSelect/> </InputText> </label>

value DescriptionThe value of the input. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the input value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring placeholder DescriptionPlaceholder attribute of the input. Typestring disabled DescriptionDisables the input. Typeboolean

name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring defaultValue DescriptionThe default value of the select input. Typeboolean children Description<option> jsx tags with provided "value" attr TypeReact.FC | React.FC[]
children DescriptionThe string value of the label. Typestring

value DescriptionThe value of the input. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the input value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring placeholder DescriptionPlaceholder attribute of the input. Typestring disabled DescriptionDisables of the input. Typeboolean

The <Slider/> component simplifies the creation of embeded image gallery, or slider. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.9.2.
The <Textarea/> component simplifies the creation of text inputs that span multiple lines. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.8.0.
The <Select/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/select
import { Select, SelectGroup } from "matro-ui"; Copy SelectGroup: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components. Select: The select input itself.
Loading... Copy Live Editor <SelectGroup defaultValue="_"> <Select value="_" disabled>Select Value</Select> <Select value="2">2</Select> <Select value="3">3</Select> </SelectGroup>

Pass the fitContent prop to set width value to: fit-content. Loading... Copy Live Editor <SelectGroup defaultValue="_" fitContent> <Select value="_" disabled>Select Value</Select> <Select value="2">2</Select> <Select value="3">3</Select> </SelectGroup>

defaultValue DescriptionThe defauilt value of the group. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the input value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring style DescriptionAdditional styling prop. Typeobject children DescriptionAny possible React Children. At least one <Select/> is required. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number fitContent DescriptionSet width to fit-content if true. Typeboolean
value DescriptionSelect option value. Typestring | number disabled DescriptionDisables of the select option. Typeboolean
The <Radio/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/radio
import { Radio, RadioGroup } from "matro-ui"; Copy RadioGroup: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components. Radio: The radio input itself.
Loading... Copy Live Editor <RadioGroup defaultValue="2"> <Radio value="1">Value 1</Radio> <Radio value="2">Value 2</Radio> </Radio>

Pass the disabled prop to disable any radio option. Loading... Copy Live Editor <RadioGroup defaultValue="2"> <Radio value="1" disabled>Value 1</Radio> <Radio value="2" disabled>Value 2</Radio> <Radio value="3">Value 3</Radio> </Radio>

Pass the font-size to change the size of the Radio. Values can be either px, em, rem or %. Loading... Copy Live Editor <RadioGroup defaultValue="2" style={{fontSize: "21px"}}> <Radio value="1" style={{fontSize: "0.7em"}}>Value 1</Radio> <Radio value="2">Value 2</Radio> <Radio value="3">Value 3</Radio> </Radio>

You can override the color scheme of the radio to any color by providing the css variable --bg to RadioGroup or Radio. Loading... Copy Live Editor <RadioGroup defaultValue="2" style={{"--bg": "purple"}}> <Radio value="1">Value 1</Radio> <Radio value="2" style={{"--bg": "#48b048"}}>Value 2</Radio> <Radio value="3" style={{"--bg": "#4848d7"}}>Value 3</Radio> </RadioGroup>

defaultValue DescriptionThe defauilt value of the group. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the input value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring style DescriptionAdditional styling prop. Typeobject children DescriptionAny possible React Children. At least one <Group/> is required. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number

value DescriptionRadio input value. Typestring | number style DescriptionAdditional styling prop. Typeobject disabled DescriptionDisables the input. Typeboolean children DescriptionLabel of the radio input. Typestring
Matro UI provides you with the tools you need to create fast, beautiful and functional user interfaces. Here is an overview of the component categories:
Checkbox Input Number Input Text Radio Select Slider Textarea
Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page: src/pages/index.js → localhost:3000/ src/pages/foo.md → localhost:3000/foo src/pages/foo/bar.js → localhost:3000/foo/bar

Create a file at src/pages/my-react-page.js: src/pages/my-react-page.js import * as React from 'react'; import Layout from '@theme/Layout'; export default function MyReactPage() { return (

My React page

This is a React page

 ); } Copy A new page is now available at http://localhost:3000/my-react-page.
Create a file at src/pages/my-markdown-page.md: src/pages/my-markdown-page.md # My Markdown page This is a Markdown page Copy A new page is now available at http://localhost:3000/my-markdown-page.
The <Stack/> is a layout component that allows to group components together and create a space between them. Source@matro-ui/stack

<Stack/> has two axis - main and cross (MDN: learn more). To align items by the main axis use justify prop (val: start, end, center, spaceBetween, spaceAround):

children DescriptionThe children/s of the Stack. Typeany wrap DescriptionIndicates whether the Stack has to wrap the overflow items / or shrink the existing ones. Typeboolean column DescriptionSet Stack direction to column if true. Typeboolean Defaultbool:false justify DescriptionSet Stack items justify option. Type"start" | "end" | "center" | "spaceBetween" | "spaceAround" Default"start" align DescriptionSet Stack items align option. Type"start" | "end" | "center" | "stretch" Default"start" padding DescriptionSet Stack padding (inner spacing) Typestring | number margin DescriptionSet Stack margin (outside spacing) Typestring | number gap DescriptionStack items gap (spacing between items) Typestring | number Default5px

To use Matro UI in your project, run one of the following commands in your terminal: npm yarn pnpm bun npm install matro-ui Copy yarn add matro-ui Copy pnpm add matro-ui Copy bun add matro-ui Copy After installing Matra UI, no further actions are required. By design, we decided not to overload Matra with Context Providers and other "heavy" things. However, this may change in the future.

Here's a quick example of how you can do it using something like Create React App: import React from "react"; import * as ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import { Button } from "matro-ui"; ReactDOM.render( <Button>This button looks great.</Button>, document.getElementById("root") ); Copy

You've successfully installed Matro UI and added your first component to your project. Now, you're ready to dive deeper and explore the full range of components and features Matro UI has to offer. Whether you're building a simple website or a complex web application, Matro UI provides you with the tools you need to create beautiful and functional user interfaces. To explore more components, check out the components page. Happy coding!
